trigger_event: During routine maintenance, Lenart discovers two sealed message vaults deep in a legacy server—one is Halden’s confessional manifesto for the public, the other a cache of secret journals from disappeared citizens. Only one can be released—the system will wipe the other.
dilemma: Lenart must choose which vault to unleash: Halden's personal confessions or the survivors' raw testimonies. This single act will shape how the city faces its past and future.
reason: Lenart is torn: Halden's confession might spark thoughtful dialogue about the system’s purpose and philosophy, while the survivors’ journals might bring cathartic reckoning and force overdue justice. He worries about unleashing too much chaos versus reinforcing collective denial. His own experiences with both sides—system invisibility and neighborhood struggle—make each choice personal.
choice_a: Release Halden's confessional letters to the city, letting his doubts and motives fuel citywide soul-searching about compliance and freedom.
belief_a: People need to understand the intentions behind control, not just its failures.
Collective debate, not vengeance, leads to progress.
System change requires acknowledgment of its inner logic first.
choice_b: Release the detainees’ journals, sparking survivor-led forums and exposing the Council’s secret abuses for all to see.
belief_b: Only real stories break cycles of control and silence.
Accountability must start with the harmed, not the architects.
Truth without filters is necessary, even if it shatters the old order.
